channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump just added another $1.8 billion to his Truth Social fortune—on paper
item.description: He now controls another 36 million shares, almost 65% of the company.

item.title: Cruise line Viking targets $10.4 billion valuation in IPO
item.description: The company's initial public offering coincides with a strong rebound in cruise bookings.

item.title: Japan has had so many bear attacks in the past year it’s turning to AI to act as a warning system
item.description: More than 200 people have been injured.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Super Micro Computer, Starbucks, Pfizer and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Chase IHG One Rewards Business Premier card ups its welcome bonus—Ends soon
item.description: Chase announced new welcome bonuses for its IHG One Rewards consumer credit cards. New cardholders can earn up to 165,000 bonus points, depending on which card they choose.

item.title: Nvidia-backed GPU cloud provider CoreWeave surges to $19 billion valuation
item.description: CoreWeave intends to set up more of its clouds full of graphics processing units in more places around the world as it goes up against Amazon and Google.

item.title: Outdated laws prevent gig economy workers from getting benefits. This pilot program shows the path forward
item.description: Benefits for app-based workers can be flexible, portable, and proportional to the hours they put in.

item.title: Once-hot AI play Super Micro is getting crushed, but most analysts are staying bullish
item.description: Despite Wednesday's pullback, major Wall Street banks are optimistic about Super Micro's long-term prospects for the most part.

item.title: Bumble, the dating app where women make the first move, is rolling out a feature where men get an ‘opening move’
item.description: The “opening moves” feature will be an optional one.

item.title: Super Micro plummets 18% after posting revenue miss
item.description: Super Micro Computer shares plunged on Wednesday after the server company reported third-quarter revenue that slightly missed estimates.
